relations.head: METTL14
relations.label: methylate
relations.text: Overexpression of Mettl14 dramatically increased m6 A modification of α-syn mRNA and weakened its stability.

relations.head: N6-methyladenosine
relations.label: is on
relations.text: α-syn mRNA was modified by Mettl14 binding of an m6 A motif in the coding region of α-syn mRNA.

relations.head: YTHDF2
relations.label: bind
relations.text: Ythdf2 was involved in recognizing m6 A-modified α-syn mRNA.

analysis:
Context:  
The abstract explicitly investigates α-synuclein regulation via METTL14-mediated m6A modification in Parkinson’s disease (PD); thus, the context is “Parkinson’s disease,” context type = “disease.”

Nodes (with context-specific status):  
• METTL14 → gene, down (explicitly decreased in PD)  
• METTL3 → gene, down (explicitly decreased in PD)  
• YTHDF2 → gene, down (explicitly decreased in PD)  
• N6-methyladenosine (m6A) → epitranscriptomic modification, down (overall m6A levels decreased in PD)  
• α-synuclein → protein, none (no explicit statement that α-syn is up/down in PD, so status = none)  

Regulatory Relationships (direct statements in the abstract):  
1) METTL14 methylates m6A, leading to decreased α-synuclein (weakened mRNA stability).  
2) m6A is on α-synuclein.  
3) YTHDF2 binds m6A, causing decreased α-synuclein (decay of α-syn transcripts).
